algorithm_technique: Greedy approach based on XOR properties and parity
problem_summary_simple: Maximize node value sum in a tree by XORing values with k, considering edge operations.
problem_summary_technical: Maximize sum of node values in a tree by applying XOR k operation on edges, leveraging parity and minimum difference.
key_insights: The operation on an edge flips the bits of both connected nodes. This means applying the operation twice on the same edge cancels out.
The effect of operations on nodes can be analyzed by considering the parity of operations applied to paths from a root.
The greedy choice is to XOR a node with k if it increases its value, and this decision is constrained by the parity of operations on connected components.
